@graph.skos:definition: Concepts related to the systematic study of the structure and behavior of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment, and the application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes.
Concepts related to the expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, and activities providing amusement or enjoyment.
Concepts related to commercial, industrial, or professional activities, and the management of money, investments, and other financial instruments.
Concepts related to people, their communities, and their cultural practices and institutions.
Concepts related to physical, mental, and social well-being, and the pursuit of a healthy lifestyle.
The study of matter, energy, and the fundamental forces of nature.
The science of substances, their properties, and how they interact.
The study of celestial objects and phenomena beyond Earth.
Study of Earth's structure, properties, processes, and history.
The study of the solid Earth, rocks, and the processes by which they change.
The study of weather, climate, and atmospheric phenomena.
The exploration and scientific study of the ocean and its phenomena.
The study of living organisms and life processes.
The study of genes, genetic variation, and heredity.
The study of interactions between organisms and their environments.
Application of biology in technology and industry.
The scientific study of plants.
The study of animals and their biological processes.
The study of microscopic organisms.
The study of the nervous system, including the brain.
Theoretical foundations of computer science and computation.
Design and implementation of programming languages.
Simulation of human intelligence by machines.
Interconnected systems for data communication.
Methodologies for software design and development.
Structured systems for storing, retrieving, and managing data.
Protection of systems and networks from digital attacks.
Design of user-centered computer systems.
Design and analysis of machines and mechanical systems.
Study and application of electricity and electronics.
Design and construction of infrastructure like roads and bridges.
Application of chemistry in industrial processes.
Development of aircraft and spacecraft.
Engineering solutions for environmental protection.
Application of engineering principles to medicine.
Abstract study of numbers, structures, and space.
Mathematics used in practical fields like physics and engineering.
Collection, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of data.
Mathematical analysis of random phenomena.
Extraction of knowledge from structured and unstructured data.
Use of computers and telecommunications for data processing.
Design and construction of robots.
Decentralized digital ledger technologies.
Delivery of computing services over the internet.
Interconnection of everyday devices to the internet.
The practice of applying pigment to surfaces to create expressive images.
The art of creating three-dimensional forms using various materials.
Capturing images using a camera to create visual art.
Creative planning and crafting of visual communication or functional objects.
Artistic works created or presented using digital technology.
Dramatic performance presented live to an audience.
Art of movement often set to music, expressing ideas or emotions.
A dramatic work combining text and musical score, usually sung.
Live performance featuring acrobatics, clowns, and trained animals.
Narrative literary works created from imagination rather than facts.
Literary work using distinctive style and rhythm to express emotions.
Prose writing based on facts, real events, and real people.
Literary composition intended to be performed by actors.
Short pieces of writing on particular subjects.
Formal musical tradition rooted in Western culture.
Music characterized by swing and blue notes, improvisation, and syncopation.
Popular music with strong rhythm and electric instruments.
Music employing electronic instruments or digital technology.
Traditional music from cultures around the world.
The process of creating motion pictures.
The art and craft of writing scripts for film and television.
Creating the illusion of motion through frame-by-frame imagery.
Non-fictional motion picture intended to document reality.
Serialized programming created for TV broadcast or streaming.
Electronic games played using a computer or console.
Games involving counters or pieces moved on a pre-marked surface.
Games in which players assume roles in a fictional setting.
Games that emphasize problem-solving skills.
Planning and execution of projects to meet specific goals.
Setting objectives and managing resources to achieve long-term goals.
Design and control of business operations and production.
Management of employee relations and organizational workforce.
Overseeing the flow of goods, services, and information.
Creating and maintaining a brand's image and identity.
Use of digital channels to promote products or services.
Gathering and analyzing data about consumers and markets.
Planning and execution of sales processes and tactics.
Study of the economy as a whole, including inflation and GDP.
Study of individual consumers and businesses in markets.
Exchange of goods and services across national borders.
Analysis of psychological factors in economic decision-making.
Planning how to allocate personal income and expenses.
Allocating money to assets for future financial return.
Saving and investing for life after employment.
Borrowing money and managing repayment responsibilities.
Sale of goods directly to consumers.
Production of goods using labor and machinery.
Buying, selling, and managing land and property.
Management of money, credit, and financial services.
Service-based industry including lodging, food, and tourism.
A system of government where power is vested in the people.
Principles guiding government actions and legislation.
Interactions between countries and their governments.
Rights protecting individuals' freedom from infringement.
Study of early civilizations and events before the Middle Ages.
History from the late 15th century to the present.
Historical study of armed conflict and warfare.
Study of cultures, customs, and arts over time.
The study of moral principles that govern behavior.
Philosophical inquiry into the nature of reality.
Major global religious traditions and beliefs.
Study of assumptions and methods in science.
Concepts and frameworks guiding teaching and learning.
Planning and structuring educational content.
Education delivered via digital platforms.
Teaching and development of young children.
Unequal distribution of resources and opportunities.
Exploration of gender identity, roles, and relations.
Environmental issues intersecting with social equity.
Movement of people across borders for various reasons.
Scientific study of language structure and use.
Rendering text or speech from one language to another.
The art of effective speaking and writing.
Ability to critically evaluate and interpret media content.
Medical specialty dealing with prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of adult diseases.
Branch of medicine dealing with children and their diseases.
Use of operative techniques to treat injuries or disorders.
Processes and tools used to determine health conditions.
Dietary plan including all essential nutrients.
Products used to add nutrients to the diet.
Study of how food affects health and body function.
Mental health conditions affecting eating behaviors.
Physical activity that improves cardiovascular conditioning.
Exercise focused on building muscle strength and endurance.
Activities that improve range of motion and flexibility.
Study of the body's response to physical activity.
Conditions characterized by excessive fear or worry.
Mood disorder causing persistent sadness and loss of interest.
Professional support for mental and emotional issues.
Mental state achieved by focusing on the present moment.
Study of disease distribution and determinants in populations.
Efforts to inform and motivate healthy behaviors.
Use of vaccines to prevent infectious diseases.
Plans and decisions to achieve health care goals.
Branches of science that study non-living systems, such as physics, chemistry, and astronomy.
Disciplines that study living organisms, including biology, genetics, and ecology.
The study of computational systems and computers, including theory and applications.
Application of scientific and mathematical principles to design and build structures, machines, and processes.
The study of numbers, quantities, shapes, and data, including pure and applied branches.
Practical use of scientific knowledge for purposes like IT, robotics, and digital innovation.
Forms of art that are primarily visual in nature, such as painting, sculpture, and photography.
Art forms in which artists use their voices, bodies, or objects to convey artistic expression before an audience.
Written and spoken works of artistic or intellectual value, including fiction, poetry, and essays.
The art of arranging sound to create expressive compositions and performances.
The medium and industry of producing visual narratives for entertainment or education.
Structured forms of play, often for entertainment or competition, including video, board, and role-playing games.
Coordinating people and resources to achieve organizational goals effectively and efficiently.
Activities involved in promoting and selling products or services, including market research and advertising.
The study of production, consumption, and transfer of wealth in societies.
Managing individual or household finances, including budgeting, investing, and saving.
Specific sectors of the economy engaged in producing goods or services, such as manufacturing or finance.
Systems of governance and political structures, including policies and public institutions.
The study and interpretation of past events, societies, and civilizations.
Study of fundamental questions and spiritual beliefs about existence, values, and meaning.
Processes and systems involved in teaching and learning across all ages.
Challenges and concerns affecting society, such as inequality, justice, and human rights.
The means and study of exchanging information through spoken, written, or visual symbols.
The science and practice of diagnosing, treating, and preventing illness and injury.
The study and practice of nourishing the body through balanced food intake.
Physical activities that enhance or maintain physical health and performance.
Psychological well-being and the treatment of mental conditions.
Efforts to protect and improve the health of populations through prevention and education.
